page.title: 116.7.85 - DORIS MONKHOUSE
page.content: Doris got up at 7.00, made the breakfast, put on the washing machine, washed up and made the beds. By 8.30 the washing was on the line and Doris was on her way to Diss to do some shopping. She returned at 10.30 to take a cottage pie out of the freezer and get the vegetables ready for lunch. After coffee at 11 she dusted and hoovered and went to get the washing in to fold ready for ironing. By then the lunch was cooked, which consisted of cottage pie, greens, carrots, fresh strawberries and ice cream. Doris drove to Kenninghall for a hair appointment when she had done the washing up. At 3.15 when she returned she was able to watch the closing games of Wimbledon Women's Tennis Final on television. This was followed by a cup of tea and the ironing. The dog needed to be fed at
